name: Westin Diplomat Resort and Spa

reviews.text: 3 stays at this hotel for business in 5 years. This is what a 650 million dollar building looks like. The ocean views are astonishing. My first room was an end unit with an ocean view - I wish my family had been able to come along. The 2nd time it was a more modest room with a bay view. Still a nice room. The 2 level pool with a glass floor in the upper pool is astounding. I did try to get souvenirs but a walk of the area revealed miles of run-down condos in all directions (nonetheless populated by Mercedes drivers). The 3rd trip, I stayed at the golf course resort and was amazed and felt the most relaxed in a hotel room in over a decade. It was the height of comfort, in the middle of the summer. Of course, by that trip I had given up on local scenery and just stayed in the hotel complex. Food is quite good. Service is gracious. Security is high but for good reason. This is not the quiet midwest, after all.
reviews.title: 3 stays

Beautiful hotel but not without hiccups
reviews.text: At first glance, this gorgeous hotel is to notch, all the staff are friendly and the public areas are spotless. Unfortunately, my initial impression was thwarted at reception when the woman couldn't figure out my reservation and offered me an upgraded room just to tell me it wasn't available for my entire stay so I couldn't have it (not a problem but maybe she shouldn't have offered it to begin with). When I finally got room keys and headed up to my room which was happily overlooking the beautiful pools and gorgeous ocean I relaxed about the check in blunder until I found my bathroom to be unclean. There was hair from a previous traveler, something oily on the shower door and two mirrors had splatter of some sort on them. I called to the guest services and they were apologetic and offered to send housekeeping right away which was agreeable to me. I left a note of the things that should be cleaned on the bathroom door and vacated the room. Upon my return the hair and oil had been cleaned but the mirrors remained dirty however I didn't follow up. The longer I stayed, the more issues I found in the room. The refrigerator was broken, there was wallpaper peeling from the bathroom wall and although this isn't the hotel's fault, a family with a crying baby ended up in the room next to me which sadly had an adjoining door to my room so I was privy to the baby's woes. On my last night there the hotel actually had me checking out so I didn't receive housekeeping service or points which were given in lue of service. After reviewing the bill, I was charged for several calls when the only time I ever picked up the phone was to call to guest services and to another room at the hotel.

I will say, Simone in the coffee/snack shop was an absolute gem! Everyone was very friendly and helpful outside of my check in experience but Simone truly stood out as she provided excellent service and managed to personalize it so that I felt like I wasn't just another guest to her. Chris the concierge was also very helpful and I appreciated his follow through when assisting me.
reviews.title: I wish i could live there!

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel was lovely and staff were very nice. I'd like to think I just managed to get a bad room and that the other ones are in better shape. I'd return to this property but would fuss if I encountered similar issues again.

The beds weren't quite as "heavenly" as others made them out to be but were comfortable nevertheless. The entire resort was beautiful and kept clean at all times. The fresh scent upon entering the lobby was wonderful. All staff we encountered (with the exception of restaurant waitstaff) were friendly and efficient. Extra kudos go to Victoria and Laurie at the Concierge desk and Anthony at the spa.

reviews.text: I stayed here for a short mini vacation. I'll split my review by sections:
reviews.title: Nice, but pricey!

reviews.text: Lobby/Overall Hotel- This hotel is very nice. The hotel and lobby are fancy, modern and comfortable. In the evening they have someone playing the piano, which creates a nice atmosphere to just sit back and relax.
reviews.title: Property is nice, service is lacking
Excellent
reviews.text: Hotel customer service- The service I experienced wasn't all that great, it was just okay, at best. When we arrived at 4:30 pm we checked in and requested a room on the highest level available. We were told that they could place us on the 32nd floor if we waited a bit for housekeeping to clean our room, so we waited about an hour and received a call when our room was ready. When we arrived to the front desk to check-in, we were told they were going to put us on the 18th floor. When they told us this we were confused because we waited an hour to be placed on the 32nd floor only to find out that we basically waited for nothing. When we questioned the guy at the front desk, he said that the room wouldn't be ready for another 2 hours so to not have us wait longer, they decided to not place us on the higher floor. This wouldn't have bothered me so much if they at least had the courtesy to apologize and explain that the higher floor wasn't available when they called to tell us the room was ready. The front desk clerk didn't apologize or seem to even care. I didn't want to make a huge issue being that it was my vacation and didn't want to become more irritated by the lack of guest service so I let it go. Considering how expensive this hotel is, I really expected better service. The following sections will cover other areas where they lacked in their customer service.

Restaurants- Before I even start on this section, be prepared, food is super expensive here (gratuity was automatically included on all onsite dinning establishments I visited). Lets begin with breakfast at the Cafe. The atmosphere of the Cafe is very nice, but the customer service was poor both times I visited. The first time I got the Diplomate Breakfast and it was pretty good, my boyfriend got the Egg White Omelet with Spinach and he liked his as well, however, our server seemed unhappy and didn't exemplify good customer service. The second day we went for breakfast again and I got the pancakes (once again pricey) and my boyfriend got some yogurt pancakes, we both didn't like it. Their pancakes were dry, cheap and flavorless. Our server (different one) also lacked customer service skills. I did see some employees that were genuinely nice and seemed great, but it was really hit and miss. The hostess' were the ones that seemed the most friendly, always smiling and helpful. A couple of the servers seemed nice, but others just seemed like they really didn't care.
reviews.title: Conference for work

reviews.text: Rivals- Food here was pretty good, once again though, the service was a bit lacking from our servers (we went twice). In fact, the runners (people bringing out the food) were more friendly than most the servers. It seems like some of the people working here weren't happy.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels for our vacations!!!

reviews.text: I was here for a large convention July 2012. Here are my thoughts:
reviews.title: 3 star property priced as a 4+ star property

reviews.text: Pros: ocean and pool area are beautiful, rooms are small but updated, staff is competent and friendly, banquet food is good, work out room is large with new equipment, variety of dining options on site
reviews.title: Smart and comfortable

reviews.text: Cons: older property shows despite updating in finishes, worn linens and bedding, wifi visible but not working in the conference center, no outlets at the conference tables, Internet in the rooms is glacial, USA Today available in the elevator areas of each floor, but was always gone by the time I went to get one
reviews.title: Beautiful Rooms!

reviews.text: Overall, if I was here for the beach I might have had a better experience. I would put this Westin on the level of your run of the mill full service hotel/resort. I give it a "meh".
reviews.title: Beautiful place!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night whilst on a road trip. First impressions were good as the valet parking system coped well with lots of concurrent arrivals. The hotel lobby was a big disappointment with plastic palm trees and a large water feature that reeked of bleach. We had chosen a corner suite with ocean view and loved our room. It was spacious, smart and well furnished. The bed was one of the most comfortable that we have had anywhere. Our balcony was large with great views of the ocean. We paid extra to use the facilities of the Westin Executive Club. This is an excellent facility with a nice ambience and comfortable seating as well as two large terraces with stunning views of both the ocean and the Intercoastal. Evening drinks and hors d'oeuvres were rather limited but the continental breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice of fresh fruit, pastries, meats, cheeses, salmon, etc. Our first choice restaurant - Aizia - was closed so we had drinks and dinner in Rivals Sports Bar which did not disappoint. Service was generally good despite the hotel being almost full. We would happily return for another visit.
reviews.title: "Excellent Hotel"

reviews.text: Had our second stay at the Diplomat and let's start with the confessions - yes it was a business trip and yes (most of) my expenses were covered. We enjoyed a corner suite which was spacious with a balcony facing the ocean. Particularly pleased with the Bose sound system in both the bedroom and living area as well as the shower (separate stall, rainwater overhead shower as well as handheld shower).
reviews.title: Enjoyable, Quiet Time at the Diplomat

reviews.text: Our family with three teenagers enjoyed what was predominantly a sun worshipping few days around the pool (for them - me, conference rooms until the sun went down). Poolside service was great and the Splash restaurant served a good meal poolside.

reviews.text: This hotel far exceeded my expectations. After staying in various other hotels up and down the east coast, the Westin has established a new benchmark for our family to base upon. The staff, room and facilities were outstanding. My kids loved the pool and easy beach access. Parking was understandable at $20 per day, but well worth the convenience. I will be returning.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Ever!

reviews.text: Attended a conference at this Hotel in early May 2012. Rooms are quite nice, great location with a quick drive to the Aventura Mall and a 40 minute drive to Sawgrass Outlet Mall. The beach at the Hotel is great, facilities are clean. Large multi-level pool area. Would return in the future.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We went the during the week of 4th of July. It was very busy because of the holiday but service was great! Everyone goes out of their way to welcome guests & meet the guests needs. We had a large room with an ocean view, you could even see the ocean from the bathtub! Great location. We will definately go back! The only downside is they charge too much for wi-fi & parking. You will have a great time at the Westin Diplomat!
reviews.title: Great resort!

reviews.text: Great location on the beach with plenty to do in and around the hotel.
reviews.title: Wish I'd had more time

reviews.text: I was here for Hot Shots cheerleading camp the week of July 4th. We decided to stay two extra days since the resort looked so nice. The pools were very nice but did get crowded later in the day and ALOT of crying children. I would not go here for a romatic getaway but it is great for families. We tried many of the restrauants and they were all good with generous portions, prices were high but at least the food was good. Drinks were very overpriced. I walked to the Walmart up the street and bought my wine and kept it in the room
reviews.title: Nice place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here last 4th of July and did it again this year. The hotel has many of the same great people working as they did last year. We had a corner beach view suite that was clean. We ordered room service which came fast and was delicious. The Platinum lounge food wasn't as great as it was last visit, but we still enjoyed it very much. We had to call downstairs for the newspaper everyday which was odd. Usually SPG members get it delivered to their door. All and all it was an amazing trip. We even walked one night back from the boardwalk because we missed the trolley. It was far at all. This hotel is in a great location. Stay away from the sports bar across the walk way. Overpriced crap. Got buffalo wings for $14 and they were tiny and wet. Actually made me sick later in the evening.
reviews.title: This place is still great

reviews.text: *Note to SPG Members*
reviews.title: VERY GOOD HOTEL!

reviews.text: This Westin does not, and I repeat does not give the promised Green 500 points. Last year I stayed for 5 nights, declined house service everyday just to collect the 500 points per night. I never received them. Called numerous times and finally was told there was no proof I declined house service.This time I made sure to go to the front desk the day before checking out to insure I would get credit. Girl told me she was putting them in the computer system for me. When we checked out I handed another girl at the front desk our coupons and she said she would make sure I got credit. Once again, no points have been posted. The funny thing is in the lobby they have a huge banner and a spot light to promote the green choice promotion. Take it from me, use your coupons for drinks or food instead. At least they can't b.s. you with those.
reviews.title: Wow what a place

reviews.text: We're from Miami and we were just looking for a nice relaxing weekend away from home. This is a great place to do that. We were there with out toddler and he had an amazing time too. One of our favorite things were the 2 pools...very spacious and the one upstairs perfect for the kids. Food is not great but it's ok (a little pricy). The staff is very nice and helpful. Amazing views and the beach is RIGHT THERE! The rooms are great, big balconies and the bathrooms are very comfortable.
reviews.title: One of my Favorite Hotel Properties

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would go back, eventhough is a little expensive.

reviews.text: I recently traveled to Hollywood for a relaxing long weekend with a friend who had a convention at the Westin Diplomat. It is a short drive from the airport and a short drive to South Beach. It had the convenient option of turning in the rental car that we only used the first 2 days at the hotel. The building is beautiful. The lobby, rooms, and pool were immaculate. As advertised, the bedding is very comfortable.

It requires taking a short shuttle ride to the other building which was more effort than I was willing to make for a manicure. If the spa was more convenient I would have rated the overall experience 5 for Excellent.

reviews.text: The workout facility is adequate with treadmills and elliptical machines that overlook the beach. There is a boardwalk that is great for running or people watching about a mile north. There are multiple pools and plenty of lounge chairs for enjoying the beautiful Florida weather.

reviews.title: Business Trip 2nd time around
reviews.text: It was very nice again. This was my 2nd time visiting this hotel for business. Rapid check in.
All of the staff was nice. However, Santiago was a hit! He was a sweetie pie. So very nice. Jelena and Hank who checked us in were very nice too.
reviews.title: Well, I can guarantee our weekend was nicer than...

reviews.text: Both pools were very nice. Pools open 24 hrs. They had a lot of chairs and seating available. Food provided at our meetings was delicious.
reviews.title: Seek the Ocean Side

reviews.text: Rooms were very nice. Bed was extremely comfortable!
reviews.title: Banquet facility Horrible
Facilities excellent, housekeeping not so much
reviews.text: Cons: no free Wifi in the rooms. Only in the hotel lobby. This is a BIG CON!

As many of the reviewers have mentioned, I too came here for a convention. Actually, to clarify, I tagged along with my friend who was there for a business conference. Me - I was just there to lay by the pool and enjoy the beach (I just can't pass up a free stay in a fab hotel!) The hotel was beautiful and the room was outstanding. Being able to see the ocean from your tub is just a wonderful experience! In terms of their functions as a convention center, they have that down - well-oiled machine they are. The conference went on without a hitch and any potential problems were quickly resolved. Staff was amazing! I had a chance to venture to the spa which is located at the Hallendale location which they shuttled me to. Wonderful services, great staff (took a water aerobics class there) and just an all-out great few days. And to prove I am not just a leech on my friend's expense account, I have been back on my own dime and had the same experience. I have and will go back again!
reviews.title: Good for conference, great for vacation!

reviews.text: Stayed two nights at the Diplomat resort for a conference. This is a very popular hotel for conferences. There were 3 going the weekend I was there. There is a large conference center adjacent to the the hotel. The cOnference center also houses the workout center and spa. Nice workout equipment and not too busy. No views of ocean from workout center. One thing I didn't like was that there was a large glass wall facing the escalator. So as conference attendees were gong to their meetings they are staring at the people on treadmills, etc.
reviews.title: Nicest place I have stayed. Will go back.

reviews.text: I had a high floor room (35th) and access to the executive lounge. This provided breakfast and evening hour d'ourves. Much like at a Hilton.
reviews.title: Great hotel for visit to Miami visit

reviews.text: The room was large and clean. Very nice and powerful shower.
reviews.title: Plush, Five star

reviews.text: Amazing pools that are right on the ocean. Service was good throughout. Very pleasent experience with check in. When leaving it was very easy to get a taxi to the airport.
reviews.title: Great views and rooms

reviews.text: It was my second time staying here and this experience was even better than the first. We arrived a bit early, but was able to check in and the woman at the front desk was very friendly and accommodating. She even upgraded us to a room with a balcony for no extra charge.
reviews.title: Clean comfortable rooms, and an awesome pool

reviews.text: The room was very clean and the beds are probably some of the most comfortable of any hotel I've stayed at. The bathroom is also very large, clean and well equipped. Nice large shower, bathtub and separate toilet stall. Towels are plentiful and very soft.
reviews.title: Wonderful family friendly Beach Resort in south Florida

reviews.text: The pool and beach area really make this place a gem. The pool is very large and has two levels. I only saw one small hot tub, but perhaps there is another I didn't find. My only complaint about this place was that the pool waitress walked by us at least seven times and never asked if we wanted anything to drink. I went to the bar to get it myself. Not a big deal, she lost out on the tip. Other than that, every staff person we came across was very friendly and accommodating. Hope to come back soon.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Fort Lauderdale!

reviews.text: My family and I had the privilege to stay here twice this past month while taking a Caribbean cruise. The hotel is immaculate the staff is very friendly and helpful. As a lifetime Gold member I was offered a room upgrade on both our stays. The first room was a bit small but we really weren't in the room much, our second room was a corner suite ocean view i only wish we would have had the same room both times. The pool and beach area is wonderful and very family friendly. when it cam to dinner time there are not many choices near the hotel so we took a short cab ride north to the Boardwalk for dinner.I highly recommend taking time to stroll the boardwalk in Hollywood.
reviews.title: Great place for the Yoga Conference

reviews.text: We've stayed here a few times, and it never fails to impress! It's sister property, the Westin Golf & Country Club is awesome too. It's nearby, and the perfect complement to this property. There is nothing about either place that isn't spectacular. This property is large and grand, yet the service makes it feel more personal and intimate. The pools and pool bar is fantastic, despite the over-priced cabanas. It is a wonderful place and I can't wait to go back again sometime soon!
reviews.title: Relaxing at Hollywood Beach after a cruise.

description: The Westin Diplomat Resort & Spa, Hollywood, Florida is located on the Atlantic Ocean close to two major airports, our 898 guest rooms and 100 suites feature stylish and soothing beach tones.
